meanings.definition: Suitable for the time of year.
meanings.sent1: The light jacket was seasonable for the cool autumn weather.
meanings.sent2: Wearing sunglasses in the summer is seasonable to protect your eyes from the sun.
meanings.sent3: It was quite seasonable to bring an umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as seasonable as a blooming flower in spring.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fireplace made the cabin feel seasonable during the winter storm.

meanings.sent1: His arrival at the meeting was seasonable, just in time for the important discussion.
meanings.sent2: The delivery of the package was seasonable, arriving before the recipient left for vacation.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rain shower was seasonable, cooling down the hot afternoon.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was as seasonable as a well-timed warning before a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected bonus was a seasonable surprise, coming right before the holidays.
